channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: OPEC+ Members Consider Delaying Production Increase, Delegates Say
item.description: OPEC+ members are debating delaying a production increase that was supposed to start next month amid concerns over weak oil prices, delegates in the p...

item.title: ‘I’m conflicted’: I have two sons — one is a hard worker with kids and the other is a ‘carefree’ actor. Should I leave the ‘family man’ more money in my will?
item.description: “The money could be going to my grandkids.”

item.title: Should You Include REITs in Your Portfolio? And if So, Which Ones?
item.description: Homeowners and others looking to gain real-estate exposure aren’t getting the diversification they expect, research shows.

item.title: Sweetgreen’s 2024 rally stays fresh as TD Cowen upgrades salad chain to buy
item.description: Investors continued flocking to Sweetgreen Inc.’s hot stock on Wednesday as the restaurant chain piled on more gains on the heels of a fresh upgrade t...

item.title: Temu's Parent, a Victim of Competition or Its Own Success?
item.description: PDD suddenly lost a third of its value following a cautious outlook. Its founder had briefly become China’s richest man.

item.title: ‘He won’t evict him’: My husband has a tenant from hell. I put all the expenses for his property on my credit card. Am I being used?
item.description: “The tenant wants a million things fixed. I could go on, but my husband does not have the money to do the repairs.”

item.title: They're Breaking Every Retirement Rule to Be Off Now, Not Later
item.description: Some workers want to spread retirement throughout their careers, even if it means a smaller 401(k).

item.title: Job openings fall to lowest level since 2021. It’s getting harder to find work.
item.description: Job openings in the U.S. fell to their lowest levels in 3½ years, returning to prepandemic levels in another sign the labor market has softened and th...

item.title: Fears of Economic Slowdown Spark Stock-Market Selloff
item.description: The Dow industrials slid more than 600 points and the Nasdaq Composite shed 3.3%.

item.title: Philadelphia Fed President Patrick Harker to retire next June
item.description: Philadelphia Federal Reserve President Patrick Harker will retire next June, the regional Fed bank announced Wednesday.
